name: Riana Development Network
goal:
RDN’s mission has been founded on the belief that people only need opportunities and guidance to be able to achieve independence and a reasonable quality of life

RDN ensures that vulnerable people will be afforded such opportunities to gain skills, build confidence and receive support to become independent and make a positive contribution to the communities in which they live.

Outcomes of our activities are that vulnerable members of the communities will be able to :-

•access services and community activity on an equal basis to mainstream communities

•reduce isolation and improve their mental health and well being

•gain new skills which support their personal and employment development

•benefit from improved family lives

•gain full social and economic integration into the UK

•develop a unified ‘voice’ to empower the community and ensure they are considered in local strategies with regard to services and community development

Our activities include;

(1) HIV, peer support services, through 1-2-1 support, community outreach, Training community Health champions.
(2)Life Skills, Community Engagement & Youth Mentoring Programme
(3)Conservation, Nature & Horticultural Programme
(4) Education, Training and community research
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Education and training, Environment, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Research and innovation, Youth
